subject: Re: [junit] Why no assertNotEquals()
msgSnippet: ... them. ... need. ... I don t know if there s a reason for it, but what I ve done is created a subclass of TestCase and implemented lots more assert methods,
messageBody:
"Erik Mattsson" <erik.mattsson@...> wrote:
> Is there any special reasons that there are no assertNotEquals() methods?
>
> Sometimes I want to make sure that the equals() method is implemented
> correctly and therefore creating two objects that arent equal and test
them.
>
> Now I have to use the assertFalse in order to get the functionality I
need.
>
> assertFalse("Msg", ! obj1.equals( obj2 ) );

I don't know if there's a reason for it, but what I've done is created a
subclass of TestCase and implemented lots more assert methods, like
assertArrayEquals, assertContains, assertEndsWith, assertNotContains,
assertNotEmpty, etc. They are quite simple to write and they make the test
code a lot cleaner.


Erik (a different one)
